info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 9:22AM EST until January 29 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...French Broad River at Blantyre. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Action Stage. Most farm fields are flooding between the French Broad River and Brevard Rd. and between the French Broad River and Pleasant Grove Rd. At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:01 AM EST Sunday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - The river has slowly risen since heavy rain fell in the area Saturday night and exceeded Action Stage this morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise and is expected to crest around Minor Flood Stage early Monday morning. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
